meanings.definition: A plant with twining stems and white or pink funnel-shaped flowers.
meanings.sent1: The bindweeds in the garden climbed up the fence with their twisting stems.
meanings.sent2: I saw some beautiful bindweeds with pink flowers growing by the roadside.
meanings.sent3: The bindweeds in the yard seemed to be playing a game of tag with the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The bindweeds wrapped around the trellis like dancers in a graceful waltz.
meanings.sent5: The delicate bindweeds added a touch of elegance to the wild garden.

meanings.definition: To wrap or tie something tightly.
meanings.sent1: She had to bindweeds the package securely before sending it in the mail.
meanings.sent2: Please bindweeds the rope around the box to keep it closed.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bindweeds his fingers together with a rubber band as a silly challenge.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to bindweeds themselves around the tree trunk in a protective embrace.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his magic wand to bindweeds the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: To restrict or constrain someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The strict rules seemed to bindweeds the students' creativity in the art class.
meanings.sent2: The heavy chains bindweeds the prisoner, making escape impossible.
meanings.sent3: The tangled headphones always manage to bindweeds themselves into a knot in my pocket.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure seemed to bindweeds her from taking risks and trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to bindweeds the sky, blocking out the sunlight.
